bug.short_desc: Kontact/Kmail fail to start after upgrade from F23
bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem: Kontact fails to start as a whole, kmail fails to start individually.
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): 18.08.1-1.fc24.x86_64
How reproducible: Always reproducible upon start of component
Steps to Reproduce: 1. Open a console 2. Type 'kontact' or 'kmail' 3.
Actual results: Error message on console
Expected results: Program start of kmail/kontact
Additional info: Error messages on konsole:
kontact log_kontactinterface: "Cannot load library /usr/lib64/qt5/plugins/kmailpart.so: (/lib64/libkmailprivate.so.5: undefined symbol: _ZN4Kleo22EncryptionKeyRequesterC1EbjP7QWidgetbb)" [0930/072713:FATAL:scoped_file.cc(29)] Check failed: 0 == IGNORE_EINTR(close(fd)). : Bad file descriptor Unable to start Dr. Konqi
kmail kmail: symbol lookup error: /lib64/libKF5MessageViewer.so.5: undefined symbol: _ZN4Kleo10MessageBox8auditLogEP7QWidgetRK7QString
Starting kontact pos up an error message window saying: "Cannot load part for mail" in addition to the symbol lookup error on the console.
The system was upgraded from an existing F23 installation to F24 through dnf upgrade mechanism and kontact/kmail used to work fine on F23.

The missing symbols implies the upgrade may not have gone 100% well (some f23 pacakges may still be around).
I'd encourage you to try (as root): dnf distro-sync
to see if that helps before anymore more drastic.

dnf distro-sync returned:
Dependencies resolved. Nothing to do. Complete!

ok, next things to check, post output from:
